titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Office of the President Records, Alan Simpson Files, 1949-1979
titlestmt.author: Inventory prepared by Laura Streett

publicationstmt.publisher: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Laura Streett, 2014

did.head: Collection Summary
did.origination: Vassar College. Office of the President, Simpson, Alan, 1912-1998
did.unittitle: Office of the President Records, Alan Simpson Files

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

did.abstract: Materials related to the work of the Vassar College's Office of the President during the tenure of Alan Simpson. The collection includes typical day-to-day administrative records, as well as documents related to noteworthy issues and events from the Simpson Era (1964-1977).

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Alan Simpson was the seventh President of Vassar College. He was British-born and educated. He grew up in Newcastle-on-Tyne, and studied history at both Oxford University and Harvard University. His tenure as president (1964-1977) coincided with a volatile period in U.S. history, with particular difficulties centered on U.S. campuses. Simpson was also president when the college made the decision to admit men.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, memoranda, clippings, articles, speeches, and press releases related to the work of Vassar College's Office of the President during the tenure of Alan Simpson. The collection includes typical day-to-day administrative records, as well as documents related to issues and events of note from the Simpson Era (1964-1977). Topics covered include: the curriculum, coeducation, men's education and the Vassar-Yale Study; the Black Studies Program, the Women's Studies Program, and other interdisciplinary programs; campus response to the Civil Rights Movement, the Vietnam War, and the second wave of the Women's Rights Movement; and construction of the Terrace Apartments, All Campus Dining Center (ACDC), Powerhouse Theater, and the Lockwood addition to Thompson Library.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Some files in this collection are restricted and labeled as such in the container list. Other material may need to be vetted before being released. The rest is open for research according to the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library without any additional restrictions.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to quote (publish) from unpublished or previously published material must be obtained as described in the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Additional materials related to Alan Simpson's presidency can be found in the following Vassar College archival collections:

p.archref: Clyde Griffen Coeducation and Men's Education Collection

odd.head: Encoding Information
odd.p: Encoded by Zachary Bodnar and Laura Streett, December 2014.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Transferred from the Vassar College Office of the President, 2002.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Office of the President Records, Alan Simpson Files, Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries.
